ok, then you have something bigger than I know how to fix. you need to reinstall the driver for your monitor. the new kernel disabled it. so you need to look at the contents of /etc/modules and add a line in there that declares your monitor type
it could also be in your bootloader though. to help, i need more knowledge maybe someone else in here can help. but we need to know your architecture
one thing you may try, is X could be the problem, so try sudo mv /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.bak
then try to startx, if it doesn't work, put it all back the way it was by sudo mv /etc/X11/xorg.conf.bak /etc/X11/xorg.conf
